creator: gregg.nelson@co.ramsey.mn.us
text:
Using the --with-prefix option on the "configure" script under Redhat Linux 9.0 
causes the following problems at versions  2.0.47 - 2.0.48.
 apachectl start
    no listening sockets available, shutting down
    Unable to open logs

If apache running, then
 apachectl stop 
    httpd (no pid file) not running

Leaving the --with-prefix option off the "configure" scripts allows apachectl 
to work correctly.

apachectl is a simple shell script.

Please look inside the script and see what the problem is.  My guess is
that you are using an apachectl script from a different version of
apache or something along those lines.

In addition, there is no "--with-prefix" option.  Do you mean "--prefix"?
creator: slive@apache.org
trawick@apache.org
text: no response from submitter; please re-open if you can provide requested information
